title: Sanctions have denied Iran more than $10 billion in oil revenue, US official says
text: U.S. sanctions against Iran have denied its government more than $10 billion in oil revenue, a U.S. official said on Thursday.

title: Oil prices fall as soaring US supply offsets tighter Iran sanctions
text: Oil prices fell on Thursday as record U.S. output and rising crude stockpiles dampened the impact on markets of tighter U.S. sanctions on Iran and producer club OPEC’s continued curbs on supply.

title: South Korea economy unexpectedly contracts in first quarter, worst since global financial crisis
text: South Korea's economy unexpectedly shrank in the first quarter, marking its worst performance since the global financial crisis.

title: Built Robotics brings self-driving to construction
text: Built is taking the concepts and technology that others are using to build self-driving cars and adapting them for a whole different vertical: construction.

title: Mario Gabelli on Amazon leaving NY: 'It was a mistake you have to be financial illiterate'
text: Mario Gabelli of Gamco Investors discusses why Amazon leaving New York was a big mistake.  He also discusses the Disney-Fox acquisition.

title: Mario Gabelli: 'Businesses look at the United States as a good place to be'
text: Mario Gabelli CEO of GAMCO Investors Inc. discusses the stock market, IPOs and media industry with Jen Rogers and Myles Udland of Yahoo Finance.

title: SciPlay IPO: What Investors Need to Know About the Mobile Game Specialist
text: The Scientific Games spinoff will make its stock market debut in early May.

title: What is Huawei? Yahoo Finance explains
text: Huawei is more than just a Chinese phone manufacturer. Huawei can pose a real threat to U.S. national security, Yahoo Finance explains how and why with security analyst Samm Sacks.

title: Earnings will continue to be better than expected this quarter, says market strategist
text: CNBC's "Closing Bell" team breaks down what is moving markets with Jack Caffrey, portfolio manager at J.P. Morgan, Kristina Hooper, chief global market strategist at Invesco, and CNBC's Rick Santelli at the CME.

title: Melinda Gates talks investing in female led businesses
text:
Melinda Gates, author of 'The Moment of Lift,' discusses her venture capital and incubation business, Pivotal Ventures that focuses on the advancement of women.

title: Begin to trim expensive items from your portfolio: Investing pro
text: Michael Farr, president and CEO of Farr, Miller & Washington and CNBC contributor, and CNBC's Bob Pisani join CNBC's "Power Lunch" team to discuss how the markets are trading and what to watch for in earnings reports.

title: Workers are revolting against the open office concept, here's why it's not working
text: Ethan Bernstein, Harvard Business School, and Katharine Schwab, Fast Company associate editor, join 'The Exchange' to make the case for cubicles as workers are revolting against the open office concept.

title: Insurance industry must change to offer add-on services, expert says | Squawk Box Europe
text: Susan Holliday, principal insurance specialist at the International Finance Corporation, discusses the insurance sector.

title: San Francisco considers tax change to cash in on the tech IPO wave
text: San Francisco District 4 supervisor Gordon Mar plans to propose a 1.12% payroll tax on stock-based compensation for the November ballot.

title: Continue to be optimistic on the global economic recovery, says UBS' Rob Sechan
text: Brenda Vingiello, Sand Hill Global Advisors CIO, and Rob Sechan, UBS Private Wealth Management, join 'Fast Money Halftime Report' to discuss mid-day markets. They look at what could be propelling stocks.

title: We should expect the market to hit new highs, says strategist
text: Brian Levitt, senior investment strategist at Oppenheimer, and CNBC's Mike Santoli join the "Squawk Alley" team to discuss the market's new highs and the potential for investment.

title: Fundamentals suggest reason for cautious optimism, says Adviser Investments CIO
text: Lisa Shalett, CIO at Morgan Stanley, and Jim Lowell, Adviser Investments CIO, join "Squawk on the Street" to discuss the record-breaking market and potential for further growth.

title: Doctor on Demand CEO: Going All Virtual with Humana | Mad Money | CNBC
text: Jim Cramer chats with Doctor on Demand CEO Hill Ferguson about how the private company is helping patients access care in remote places outside the doctor’s office.

title: Experience over shopping: Making malls hot again
text: CNBC's Courtney Reagan on why major mall operators around the country are getting creating with their tenant mix--betting big on experiences to keep consumers coming back for more.

title: Pisani: There's plenty of room for the wave of IPOs
text: Phil Libin, senior advisor at General Catalyst, Paul Holland, general partner at Foundation Capital, and CNBC's Bob Pisani take a look at the wave of IPOs coming in 2019 and whether there's room for all of them.

title: JP Morgan lays out a blueprint for how this record run in the stock market will keep going
text: A recovery in global growth, as well as another record year for corporate buybacks should boost earnings and stock prices, according to J.P. Morgan equity strateigsts.

title: The 100 Best Warren Buffett Quotes
text: Here’s a long list of valuable wisdom from The Oracle of Omaha that all investors need to hear.

title: What this strategist says investors got wrong about the market's bull run
text: Joyce Chang, chair of global research at J.P. Morgan, and Brian Belski, chief investment strategist at BMO Capital Markets, join "Squawk on the Street" to discuss the record-breaking markets and why bullishness has paid off in recent months.

title: Melinda Gates: I would rather live in a capitalist society than a socialist one
text: CNBC's Becky Quick sits down with Melinda Gates to discuss capitalism's role in the developing world.

title: Here are the four major factors that have led to historic market highs
text: CNBC's Bob Pisani looks ahead at the day's market action.

title: A New Green Deal -- Investing In The Energy Transition
text: Gone are the days of windmills on milk cartons. Consumer choices are echoing though the global economy and political choices have moved the markets.

title: How Warren Buffett Makes And Spends His Billions
text: Warren Buffett is the third richest person in the world, but he lives a modest life. He drinks five cokes a day and even eats McDonald's for breakfast.

text: CNBC's Becky Quick sits down with Melinda Gates to discuss venture capital funding and increasing the number of women in STEM.

title: Are These Amazon-Backed Smart Glasses Worth $600
text: Focals are the best smart glasses to hit the market so far. They're from a company called North, which received venture backing from Amazon and Intel, among others.

title: These stocks are the biggest winners in the market's incredible rebound back to a record
text: Stocks have come all the way back, ending one of their fastest and fiercest round trips in history. Here are the front-runners in this epic comeback.

title: We expect the global economy to have a pick up, says UBS's Alli McCartney
text: Alli McCartney, managing director at UBS Private Wealth Management, and Sarat Sethi, portfolio manager and equity analyst at Douglas C. Lane & Associates, and guest host Joe Terranova, senior managing director at Virtus Investment Partners, join 'Squawk Box' to discuss Occidental's offer to buy Anadarko and how the market is reacting to trade concerns.

title: Green Peak Innovations: 'Michigan's Patients Deserve Tested And Safe Cannabis'
text: The company has had difficulty selling this year’s cannabis batch since licensed distributors can buy more cheaply from unlicensed cultivators.

title: Former FDA Commissioner Scott Gottlieb on the fight against the opioid crisis
text: Former FDA Commissioner Dr. Scott Gottlieb joins "Squawk Box" to discuss the charges that have been filed against one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in the country, Rochester Drug Cooperative, regarding the ongoing opioid crisis.

title: Melinda Gates on technology, capitalism and her 'Moment of Lift'
text: CNBC's Becky Quick talks to Melinda Gates about technology, capitalism vs. socialism, and her new book 'The Moment of Lift.

title: Five mistakes to avoid when investing
text: If you want to invest like the super-wealthy, there may be some things you're doing that are holding you back. Trying to manage your investments yourself, getting into fad investing or being impatient can hurt your savings in the long run.

title: Overall we don't think there is a recession in the near term, says CIO
text: Stephanie Lang, principal and chief investment officer of Homrich Berg, and Michael Tyler, chief investment officer at Eastern Bank Wealth Management, join "Squawk Box" to discuss the quarterly earnings results that are helping to lift markets to record highs. Also at the table is the guest host for the day Joe Terranova, senior managing director at Virtus Investment Partners.

title: Is the 2019 rally justified?
text: Jeffrey Kleintop, Charles Schwab Chief Global Investment Strategist, talks the bull market, earnings, and China

title: Spring housing check
text: Mike Fratantoni, Mortgage Bankers Association Chief Economist, talks falling rates, increasing inventory, and more

title: What should the Fed do next?
text: Megan Greene, Manulife Asset Management MD & Chief Economist, discusses bond moves, the upcoming Fed meetings, and more

title: Need to Know: Don’t be ‘fooled’ by these fresh highs for stocks, warns analyst
text: Our call of the day says investors should take care as the stock market sets out new highs, because a big group of investors is sitting on the sidelines, waiting to cash in on a fall.

title: UK will reportedly allow Huawei to build out parts of its 5G networks
text: The U.K. government will reportedly allow Huawei to provide "non-core" technology for 5G wireless networks, defying U.S. demands for a blanket ban on the Chinese tech giant.

title: Saudi’s Falih sees no need for swift output action after Iran oil waivers end
text: Riyadh to stay within output limits in OPEC-led deal

title: The Middle East must avoid making the same investing mistakes as Europe, Larry Fink says
text: International investors flocked to lend money to Saudi Arabia's hugely profitable state-owned oil company earlier this month.

title: A lot of trade optimism in China has been priced in: Strategist | Capital Connection
text: Markets are very vulnerable to disappointment if we don't get as positive a trade deal as we expect, says Eli Lee, head of investment strategy at the Bank of Singapore.
